description.narrative: Post COVID-19 Recovery and Poverty Reduction are promoted through Productive Sector Expansion for Women and Youth in Lebanon

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1: 10 SME’s/Cooperatives and 300 Independent traders (especially women and youths) are better equipped to access certain specific markets to respond to the impacts by COVID-19.
• Number of newly identified markets and distribution that contribute to increase trade of women and youth entrepreneurs • Number of SME's/Cooperatives supported with improved access to income generating opportunities • Number of women and youth trained and with access to new skills • Percentage of training participants who feel their marketing skills and techniques are enhanced following the trainings (disaggregated by gender and age) • Number of Individuals supported with improved access to income generating opportunities (disaggregated by gender and age) • Number of SMEs/cooperatives benefiting from new market skills and tools • Number of individuals benefiting from new market skills and tools
Output 2: 10 Lebanese business development service institutions are better equipped to support women and youth entrepreneurs in responding to the impacts of COVID-19 and developing new skills • Number of institutions with enhanced capacity to provide Business Development Services • Number of local institutions equipped to provide trade support to local entrepreneurs • Number of local institutions equipped to facilitate/conduct training/learning programmes in specific niche areas • Percentage of training participants who feel their business development services skills are enhanced following the trainings (disaggregated by gender and age) • Number of institutions benefiting from new market skills and tools Output 3: Promote export of local featured products to accelerate the socio-economic recovery of COVID-19: • Number of Lebanese stakeholders with increased knowledge and skills • Number of governmental officials and other relevant stakeholders from Lebanon participating in trainings • Number of identified platforms to promote import and export of local subsidiary agricultural products

comment.narrative:
Output 1: 10 SME’s/Cooperatives and 300 Independent traders (especially women and youths) are better equipped to access certain specific markets to respond to the impacts by COVID-19.
• Number of newly identified markets and distribution that contribute to increase trade of women and youth entrepreneurs • Number of SME's/Cooperatives supported with improved access to income generating opportunities • Number of women and youth trained and with access to new skills • Percentage of training participants who feel their marketing skills and techniques are enhanced following the trainings (disaggregated by gender and age) • Number of Individuals supported with improved access to income generating opportunities (disaggregated by gender and age) • Number of SMEs/cooperatives benefiting from new market skills and tools • Number of individuals benefiting from new market skills and tools
Output 2: 10 Lebanese business development service institutions are better equipped to support women and youth entrepreneurs in responding to the impacts of COVID-19 and developing new skills • Number of institutions with enhanced capacity to provide Business Development Services • Number of local institutions equipped to provide trade support to local entrepreneurs • Number of local institutions equipped to facilitate/conduct training/learning programmes in specific niche areas • Percentage of training participants who feel their business development services skills are enhanced following the trainings (disaggregated by gender and age) • Number of institutions benefiting from new market skills and tools Output 3: Promote export of local featured products to accelerate the socio-economic recovery of COVID-19: • Number of Lebanese stakeholders with increased knowledge and skills • Number of governmental officials and other relevant stakeholders from Lebanon participating in trainings • Number of identified platforms to promote import and export of local subsidiary agricultural products
